paper_abstract: The universal technique of finding optimum training parameters for multi-layer perceptron-such as percentage of samples in a cross-validation set and quantities of training iterations with various initial values-is offered. This technique is aimed at the searching of optimum values of two complex factors depending on accuracy and convergence of a network, and also on the time of its training. Their conventional names are "cross-validation coefficient" and "training iteration coefficient". Near infrared spectroscopy data for gasoline samples are used to evaluate the efficiency of the method.
paper_title: Universal technique for optimization of neural network training parameters: gasoline near infrared data example
